qas.question: Who is the popular patron saint of Palermo?
When is Palermo's most important religious event of the year held?
Who is said to have ended the Black Death in 1624?

answers.text: procession which goes through the main street of Palermo to commemorate the miracle attributed to Santa Rosalia

qas.question: Who is the patron saint of Italy?
Who ended the Black Death in the 16th century?
When is Palermo's most important secular celebration?
Who banished the plague from the city before dying themselves?

context: The patron saint of Palermo is <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0><b7_0>Santa Rosalia<b7_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, who is widely revered. <b6_0>On <a1_0>14 July<b6_0/><a1_0/>, people in Palermo celebrate the annual Festino, the most important religious event of the year. The Festino is a <a3_0>procession which goes through the main street of Palermo to commemorate the miracle attributed to <a2_0>Santa Rosalia<a3_0/><a2_0/> who, it is believed, freed the city from the Black Death in 1624. Her remains were discovered in a cave on Monte Pellegrino, and her remains were carried around the city three times, banishing the plague. There is a sanctuary marking the spot where her remains were found which can be reached via a scenic bus ride from the city.
